thinking.disposable_income: Carverdale has a relatively low median household income around $35,000, with many residents working in industrial and service sectors, indicating limited disposable income.
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the low income levels, residents have minimal discretionary spending capacity and are particularly sensitive to additional taxes and transportation costs.
thinking.accessibility: The area has limited public transit access with longer transit times, while most residents rely on personal vehicles for commuting to work in nearby industrial areas and accessing services.
thinking.decision_rationale: 1) Prioritized policies with lower sales tax (0.5%) due to limited disposable income, 2) Favored lower transit fares ($0.75) to make public transit more accessible, 3) Accepted moderate driving fees ($0.50) as compromise to improve transit service while not overly burdening car-dependent residents, 4) Sought balance between reduced travel times and cost impacts, 5) Considered that many residents must drive for work but would benefit from having affordable transit options
